text: Alice E. Mayhew (June 14, 1932 â€“ February 4, 2020) was an American editor. She was vice president and editorial director for Simon & Schuster. Mayhew edited many notable authors, which include Bob Woodward, President Jimmy Carter, Doris Kearns Goodwin, David Brooks, and Ruth Bader Ginsburg. Mayhew was known for publishing books about Washington, D.C., such as All the President's Men by Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein. She was born in New York City. Mayhew died at her home in New York City on February 4, 2020 at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American editors Category:Businesspeople from New York City
